oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate muster roll of Co. G, 27th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Muster roll of Captain F. J. Wood's Co. G, 27th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA was assembled at Camp Trenton, Tennessee, in September, 1861. Most of the the men of company G hailed from Crockett and Haywood Counties. The regiment fought at Shiloh and in the Kentucky Campaign before being consolidated with the 1st Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA for the remainder of the war. As part of Maney's Brigade of the Army of Tennessee, they fought in every major engagement until the surrender in North Carolina in 1865.
